description:
Projected households

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12421 Population projections

Definition:
Household projections are based on microcensus data
concerning the evolution of households and on results of the
coordinated population projection.

In accordance with the microcensus definition, a household
is defined as any group of people who live together and
jointly run the household; people who live alone and run a
household of their own are also included under households.

The 2017 household projection comprises two variants. The
trends variant extrapolates the changes so far observed in
the distribution of the population by household size. The
status quo variant keeps the initial conditions constant.
Both variants reflect the effects of the future population
development on the number of households. However, changes in
the population's behaviour regarding household formation and
their impact on the structure of households are only
reflected in the trends variant. It therefore constitutes a
more comprehensive model for the future.
